publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-773 Richard Lochhead: Allocation of Scottish Cup Final Tickets—That the Parliament regrets the failure of the Scottish Football Association (SFA) to adhere to a policy of equal allocation of tickets for the forthcoming Scottish Cup Final, and calls upon the SFA to recognise that Hampden Park, as the National Stadium, is a publicly-backed neutral venue and that it should therefore treat equitably all clubs who appear in the Scottish Cup Final.
S1M-773 Allocation of Scottish Cup Final Tickets (lodged on 25 April 2000) Brian Adam*
S1M-773 Allocation of Scottish Cup Final Tickets (lodged on 25 April 2000) Shona Robison*

S1M-773 Richard Lochhead: Allocation of Scottish Cup Final Tickets—That the Parliament regrets the failure of the Scottish Football Association (SFA) to adhere to a policy of equal allocation of tickets for the forthcoming Scottish Cup Final, and calls upon the SFA to recognise that Hampden Park, as the National Stadium, is a publicly-backed neutral venue and that it should therefore treat equitably all clubs who appear in the Scottish Cup Final. Supported by: Brian Adam, Shona Robison
S1M-773 Allocation of Scottish Cup Final Tickets (lodged on 25 April 2000) Irene McGugan*
S1M-773 Allocation of Scottish Cup Final Tickets (lodged on 25 April 2000) Nora Radcliffe*
S1M-773 Allocation of Scottish Cup Final Tickets (lodged on 25 April 2000) Mr Brian Monteith*

S1M-773 Richard Lochhead: Allocation of Scottish Cup Final Tickets—That the Parliament regrets the failure of the Scottish Football Association (SFA) to adhere to a policy of equal allocation of tickets for the forthcoming Scottish Cup Final, and calls upon the SFA to recognise that Hampden Park, as the National Stadium, is a publicly-backed neutral venue and that it should therefore treat equitably all clubs who appear in the Scottish Cup Final. Supported by: Brian Adam, Shona Robison, Irene McGugan, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Brian Monteith, Mike Watson*
S1M-773 Allocation of Scottish Cup Final Tickets (lodged on 25 April 2000) Mr John McAllion*

S1M-773 Richard Lochhead: Allocation of Scottish Cup Final Tickets-That the Parliament regrets the failure of the Scottish Football Association (SFA) to adhere to a policy of equal allocation of tickets for the forthcoming Scottish Cup Final, and calls upon the SFA to recognise that Hampden Park, as the National Stadium, is a publicly-backed neutral venue and that it should therefore treat equitably all clubs who appear in the Scottish Cup Final. Supported by: Brian Adam, Shona Robison, Irene McGugan, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Brian Monteith, Mike Watson, Mr John McAllion

S1M-773 Richard Lochhead: Allocation of Scottish Cup Final Tickets—That the Parliament regrets the failure of the Scottish Football Association (SFA) to adhere to a policy of equal allocation of tickets for the forthcoming Scottish Cup Final, and calls upon the SFA to recognise that Hampden Park, as the National Stadium, is a publicly-backed neutral venue and that it should therefore treat equitably all clubs who appear in the Scottish Cup Final. Supported by: Brian Adam, Shona Robison, Irene McGugan, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Brian Monteith, Mike Watson, Mr John McAllion
S1M-773 Allocation of Scottish Cup Final Tickets (lodged on 25 April 2000) Fiona McLeod*

S1M-773 Richard Lochhead: Allocation of Scottish Cup Final Tickets—That the Parliament regrets the failure of the Scottish Football Association (SFA) to adhere to a policy of equal allocation of tickets for the forthcoming Scottish Cup Final, and calls upon the SFA to recognise that Hampden Park, as the National Stadium, is a publicly-backed neutral venue and that it should therefore treat equitably all clubs who appear in the Scottish Cup Final. Supported by: Brian Adam, Shona Robison, Irene McGugan, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Brian Monteith, Mike Watson, Mr John McAllion, Fiona McLeod

S1M-773 Richard Lochhead: Allocation of Scottish Cup Final Tickets-That the Parliament regrets the failure of the Scottish Football Association (SFA) to adhere to a policy of equal allocation of tickets for the forthcoming Scottish Cup Final, and calls upon the SFA to recognise that Hampden Park, as the National Stadium, is a publicly-backed neutral venue and that it should therefore treat equitably all clubs who appear in the Scottish Cup Final. Supported by: Brian Adam, Shona Robison, Irene McGugan, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Brian Monteith, Mike Watson, Mr John McAllion, Fiona McLeod

S1M-773 Richard Lochhead: Allocation of Scottish Cup Final Tickets-That the Parliament regrets the failure of the Scottish Football Association (SFA) to adhere to a policy of equal allocation of tickets for the forthcoming Scottish Cup Final, and calls upon the SFA to recognise that Hampden Park, as the National Stadium, is a publicly-backed neutral venue and that it should therefore treat equitably all clubs who appear in the Scottish Cup Final. Supported by: Brian Adam, Shona Robison, Irene McGugan, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Brian Monteith, Mike Watson, Mr John McAllion, Fiona McLeod

S1M-773 Richard Lochhead: Allocation of Scottish Cup Final Tickets—That the Parliament regrets the failure of the Scottish Football Association (SFA) to adhere to a policy of equal allocation of tickets for the forthcoming Scottish Cup Final, and calls upon the SFA to recognise that Hampden Park, as the National Stadium, is a publicly-backed neutral venue and that it should therefore treat equitably all clubs who appear in the Scottish Cup Final. Supported by: Brian Adam, Shona Robison, Irene McGugan, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Brian Monteith, Mike Watson, Mr John McAllion, Fiona McLeod

S1M-773 Richard Lochhead: Allocation of Scottish Cup Final Tickets—That the Parliament regrets the failure of the Scottish Football Association (SFA) to adhere to a policy of equal allocation of tickets for the forthcoming Scottish Cup Final, and calls upon the SFA to recognise that Hampden Park, as the National Stadium, is a publicly-backed neutral venue and that it should therefore treat equitably all clubs who appear in the Scottish Cup Final.
